pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.2: At that time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had become skilled at making robes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.3: He made an upper robe from pieces of cloth, well-dyed and beautifully executed, and he wore it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.4: Just then a certain wanderer who was wearing an an expensive robe approached Upananda and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.7: Please give it to me in exchange for my robe.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.8: “But do you know what you’re doing?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.12: The wanderer put on the upper robe and went to the wanderers’ monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.13: And the wanderers said to him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.14: “This upper robe of yours is beautiful.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.16: “I got it in exchange for my robe.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.17: “But how long will this upper robe last you?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.18: That robe of yours was better.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.19: The wanderer realized they were right,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.20: and so he returned to Upananda and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.22: “Here’s your upper robe; give me back my robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.29: How then can an ascetic not give back to another ascetic?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.31: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.33: “How can Venerable Upananda barter with a wanderer?”
